body.name: Solo Stove Bonfire Heat Deflector, with 3 Detachable Legs, Accessory for Bonfire Fire Pit, Captures and redirects Warmth, 304 Stainless Steel, (HxDia) 10 x 25 in, 7 lbs
features: SPREAD THE WARMTH FROM YOUR FIRE: Bonfire’s signature heat redirected for more fireside warmth. Heat Deflector magnifies Bonfire’s heat radius to make room for extra company or outdoor comfort in every season.

EFFECTIVE: As hot air rises and scatters, Heat Deflector captures and redirects the warmth to where you need it most. The precision-angle center cone and deflection disc are designed to tame the aimless heat so you can easily find fireside comfort.

LONG-LASTING 304 STAINLESS STEEL: Heat Deflector is built to last a lifetime of good moments alongside Bonfire. Stow in Station, handle with Gloves, or refuel with fire pit Tools. Heat Deflector’s collapsible and accessible design compliments your favorite Solo Stove accessories.

EASY TO USE: Place the deflection disc over Bonfire with Hub, or directly on the flame ring. Detachable legs latch and lock into place without extra tools or accessories so warming up is still as simple as lighting the fire.
PRODUCT SPECS: Heat Deflector with detachable legs made of 304 Stainless Steel, Weight: 7 lbs. Diameter: 25 in. Height (with legs): 10 in. Interchangeable With Hub.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Discover Warmth, Made To Share Solo Stove Bonfire Heat Deflector Heat Deflector magnifies your Bonfire fire pit’s heat radius to make room for extra company or outdoor comfort in every season. As hot air rises and scatters, Heat Deflector captures and redirects the warmth to where you need it most. Enjoy the outdoors all year round with real warmth, bringing you closer to the people who matter most. Compatible with most accessories, Heat Deflector adapts to your fire pit experience, creating memorable moments.

Previous page Effective Pressed into an angled disc, Deflector bears the flame to direct heat outwards, instead of upward. Long Lasting Constructed from 304 stainless steel, Heat Deflector is built to last a lifetime alongside Bonfire. Adaptive Compatible with most Bonfire accessories, Heat Deflector adapts to your fire pit experience. Easy Refueling Easily stoke and refuel without removing Heat Deflector, through three broad windows. Detachable legs Detachable legs latch and lock into place so warming up is still as simple as lighting the fire. Next page 1 Effective 2 Long Lasting 3 Adaptive 4 Easy Refueling 5 Detachable legs

Will Heat Deflector be hot when in use? YES! Do not touch any part of the Heat Deflector when in use. It will be extremely hot. Children should always be under parental supervision when around the fire pit and Heat Deflector. Always treat Heat Deflector like an open flame. When can Heat Deflector be removed from the fire pit? | How do I cool down Heat Deflector? Let both your Heat Deflector and fire pit cool naturally and completely before attempting to move any component of the setup. Using heat-resistant Gloves, Heat Deflector can be removed from the cooling fire pit to cool down separately. How do you clean Heat Deflector, and how often should you clean it? By keeping Heat Deflector out of the rain and humidity, cleaning sessions should be few. After a few uses, some soot will build up on the bottom of it. We recommend polishing Heat Deflector’s surfaces with Barkeepers Friend and a dry cloth. How should I use Heat Deflector? Heat Deflector is perfectly designed to fit Solo Stove Bonfire and can be assembled and placed on top once a fire is already started in Bonfire’s burn chamber.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is simple and exceedingly effective.
reviews.reviewText: This is brilliant. Turns the solo stove from a jet rocket blasting heat straight up into a radiant heater. Without this accessory it would be unsafe to use a solo stove under a portable canopy as you will have melted nylon of your canopy falling on you like napalm. But with this accessors the heat radiates outward not upward. A totally different experience and doubles the effectiveness of your solo stove.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I did a lot of thinking about this before buying it. After all it is really expensive. But after reading many reviews, and applying some basic physics, I decided to go for it. I am really glad I did.It absolutely does capture and redirect the heat noticeably. Of course there are a few caveats. First, if there is a significant wind it is less effective. But my first use was on a 45 degree night with a slight breeze, maybe 3-4 mph. Sitting my usual distance away about 3 feet the difference in radiated heat on me was very substantial and I didn’t have the usual hot and cold zones. I sat at various clock positions around and had the same experience on all positions.If I had to rate the heating of the stove with and without I’d give it a 5 without and a solid 8 with.As you can see from other reviews, this is a must have with the really cold nights. I definitely would buy again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great... even on cold days
reviews.reviewText: If you like being outside in all climates, this is the accessory to use! I enjoy a chilly night, watching the stars and relaxing with a scotch and cigar. This attachment turned my solo stove from a night beacon to a radiant heat bonfire that keeps me warm on the coolest of evenings. I like the minimal smoke from my solo, use the pellet adapter and stay warm with the now redirected heat... Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Does a great job as disbursing the heat, relatively minor issue with replacing hot deflector
reviews.reviewText: As with any of the Solo products I've purchased, it's a quality item that's well engineered, effective and expensive. Since it works as advertised and I made the decision to buy it, then it seems that I see the value, but it still seems expensive for a metal disk.I believe once I've had this longer I'll discover a better method for this, but at this point it's a little dangerous. The issue I have is with how the deflector is "installed" when you are using it. When it's cold, it's easy enough to put it on the ledge of the firepit. When you want to add wood or pellets, it's a different story. My opinion is that the smartest way to add wood is to remove the deflector and add the wood or pellets, then replace the deflector. Assuming you use gloves or a pot holder removing it is simple. Replacing it is more of a challenge, particularly if you are using pellets and some of them end up on the ledge. You have to line up the three legs on the ledge with a relatively small margin of error while a fire roars in your face. If you misalign it, or manage to land one of the legs on a couple pellets, the deflector falls off. That's definitely not a good thing. It would be great if there was a heat resistant handle off the side or similar.Most things have drawbacks somewhere, and overall I'm very happy with the performance so I'm very pleased with the purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I would get this again, but it isn't life changing. The legs should fold. That is the biggest complaint. You pay high dollar for this thing and it takes up a lot of space when the stove isn't in use. If the legs folded, you could tuck it behind something in the garage or behind the grill. The legs come off, but they are covered in soot (Which is to be expected), so having to wrestle them off is a dirty job. The heat output is ok and definitely improves things. It is still not a massive change. It is over priced, but it is a nice add on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: If you live in a cold climate, this is a must for your solo stove. We went camping twice in late fall and it was really cold out. We popped this deflector on the solo and everyone was amazed! All the heat is directed right back at everyone sitting or standing around it. I cannot recommend the deflector enough! The only thing they need to change is they should include a storage bag, it gets sooty after use. I made my own bag so we easily transport when camping.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It was a gift that was enjoyed by all
reviews.reviewText: Got as a Christmas gift for my dad for his solo stove for when the camp. He could resist trying it early really helped to deflect the heat out to everyone who sat around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for our bonfire stove. It was easy to install and like all solo products as well designed and works really well.
Great accessory from Solo Stove that definitely adds the heat-factor when used. Black-carbon build-up underneath, but easy to clean when cooled off. Friends and neighbors are impressed! Cheers!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Quite effective at pushing heat outwards, but only at leg height if your outdoors. Expensive but works
The deflector is a solid product and works well
Redirects the heat and makes your legs nice and toasty.
